bibl.title: Taka Shibata v. Henry M. White. Order to Show Cause
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: Filed in the United States District Court
In the Matter of the Application of Taka Shibata for a Writ of Habeas Corpus

The above entitled matter came on this day to be heard on the application of TAKA SHIBATA for a petition for a Writ of Habeas Corpus directed to the Hon. Henry M. White as United States Commissioner of Immigration at Seattle, Washington in said District commanding him to have the body of the said application by him imprisoned and detained together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention before the Hon. Edward M. Cushman Frank H Rudkin, Judge of said court to do and receive what shall then and there be considered ordered concerning the said applicant, and it appearing to the court that the said applicant is imprisoned and restrained of her liberty by the said Henry M. White at the United States Detention Office in Seattle, Washington and within said District and is about to deport the said applicant upon a warrant of arrest issued by the Honorable Secretary of Labor of the United States Immigration Department and it further appearing to the court that the petition for a Writ of Habeas Corpus filed herein by the said Taka Shibata alleges that such imprisonment and restraint are illegal,

WHEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the said Henry M. White, as United States Commissioner of Immigration be and he is hereby ordered and directed to be and appear before the above entitled court on the 19th day of July, 1920 at the hour of 10 o'clock A.M. in the court room of the undersigned judge of said court, and show cause, if any he have, why the petition of the said Taka Shibata for a Writ of Habeas Corpus should not be granted.
